name: 'The Hubbert Peak' Trivia Game | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: When Kate was telling Josh about the Hubbert Peak, who did she say the peak was named after?
questions.explanation:
Marion Hubbert.

	Hubbert's Peak was a model created by Marion King Hubbert that showed oil production would peak between 1965 and 1970 and that world production would peak in 2000.

questions.text: What was the name of the blog website that told of Josh's car crash?
questions.explanation:
DistrictScene.

	Josh didn't think it would be anything, but then Donna showed him the blog with a paragraph on Josh's car accident. Because of what happened, CJ made him head of the White House Task Force on Alternative Energy.

questions.text: What did Kate tell Josh was being used to sniff mines now instead of dogs?
questions.explanation:
Rat & Rats.

	Gambian giant pouch rats were used to sniff for mines because the dogs were becoming bored.

questions.text: What car was Josh looking at before he went for a test drive in an SUV?
questions.explanation:
Prius.

	Josh was looking at a Prius hybrid car. When the car dealer asked Josh if he wanted to test drive the car, Josh asked if he could test drive a red SUV he saw in the lot. He ended up ramming it into the rear of a Prius when he missed hitting a teenage girl.

questions.text: When Annabeth was talking to Toby about how men get babes, which two actors did she mention?
options: Matt Le Blanc and Charlie Sheen
questions.explanation:
Jude Law and Denzel Washington.

	Annabeth said that the only way for men who didn't look like Jude Law and Denzel Washington to get babes was by being smart and funny.

questions.text: When Toby rated his press briefings as ten being CJ, what did he rate one as?
options: Josh and his secret plan to fight inflation
The President singing in the shower
questions.explanation:
Chimp throwing feces.

	When Toby asked this question, he wanted to know where he ranked and Josh answered him saying they're getting better.

questions.text: After Charlie gave the senior staff his resume, he asked them to ignore it.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Josh was the first person viewers saw get Charlie's resume. Josh put it in the drawer. When Charlie gave it to Toby, he tore it up in front of Charlie. CJ was the next person to get Charlie's resume.

questions.text: Who offered Charlie a job after getting his resume?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	Charlie wanted CJ to ignore the resume, but instead she offered him a job that would be a "stone's throw" from the President.

questions.text: What did Margaret refer to when she said "human wave"?
options: Number of people wanting Charlie to work for them
People lining up to be the new press secretary
Calls coming in wanting Charlie's job
questions.explanation:
Press gaggle in CJ's office.

	While in the press room, Toby asked the few reporters in the room where everyone went. When CJ walked into her office, there were numerous reporters wanting her to answer their questions. When CJ asked Margaret why she let them in, Margaret said they came in like a human wave.

questions.text: When CJ got the President to play chess, she picked a man from what department to play against him?
questions.explanation:
Housing and Urban Development.

	Roger Quast played on the Stanford chess team and works for the Department of Housing and Urban Development. When CJ told the President he was going to play chess, the President told CJ he would play with her and let Stanford teach her as they played.
